info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 7:20PM PDT until July 31 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... Southeastern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 945 PM MST /945 PM PDT/. * At 720 PM MST /720 PM PDT/, Rain rates have decreased across central Mohave County, however automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain between Golden Valley and Chloride. Also, automated gauges have shows between 1 and 2 feet of water flowing through washes. Several water rescues has also taken place around Golden Valley. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingman, Laughlin, Katherine Landing, Yucca, Windy Point Campground, Packsaddle Campground, Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads, Chloride, New Kingman-Butler, Grand Canyon Ranch, Valentine, Dolan Springs, Blake Ranch Road, Dw Ranch Road, Golden Valley, Meadview, Grand Canyon Skywalk, Hualapai Mountain Park and Wild Cow Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
